"<%me>.
I must express my gratitude."
"Because of that chance encounter, a change has been observed and has lead to new possibilities."
"More than the possibilities, you seem more interested in the purpose. Am I correct?"
"You need not fully understand it."
"The only information I will divulge is that you have a chance to save many people."
"The only words that will convince you, I cannot learn..."
"I must apologize for not giving you enough information for you to trust me."
"For that, and for having to depend on you, I also apologize."
"A new Matter Board has formed. That is, new opportunities for chance encounters have become available."
"My regret continues, but I hope you will serve to remedy that."
"That's right, she was sending you to help the Second Generation after she collapsed on Naberius. That was Xion's plan."
"For that, I skipped forward to when you finished that mission... Hey, not too bad for my first try."
"The Matter Board, the realization of possibilities... The funny thing is, it has a similar feeling to my time stop."
"Magic, as Su would call it. No, maybe not quite on that level... Well, that aside."
"Even if you can travel back in time, changing history isn't easy. Time has a way of correcting things."
"For instance, if I were to change the fact that Luther killed me, I'd only end up dying some other way. That's how it usually works."
"But Xion can see the results of rewriting events. And from that, she can calculate how to get there."
"All that remains is to tell you what to rewrite. Hence the Matter Board. You can think of it as a set of instructions for creating the future."
"From here, you participate in altering events, leading to the future that Xion calculated."
"This would be impossible for either Xion or you alone. Only the two of you together could pull it off."
"Of course, even if you follow exactly what Xion says, it's not guaranteed that you can change anything."
"So you must have been unconsciously travelling back in time over and over, until you successfully changed what you needed to..."
